title: Midwives should wait two minutes before clamping umbilical cord to save lives
text:
The lives of 1,500 premature babies could be saved every year if midwives wait two minutes before clamping the umbilical cord, according to researchers.

The delay allows the full amount of stem cell-rich blood to flow from mother to child after the delivery and give a life-saving boost to the baby's immune system, British and Australian medics found.

The lives of 1,500 premature babies could be saved every year if midwives wait two minutes before clamping the umbilical cord, according to researchers. It could cut the number of premature baby deaths in Britain from 4,800 to 3,300 a year, said Andrew Weeks [File photo]

It could cut the number of premature baby deaths in Britain from 4,800 to 3,300 a year, said Andrew Weeks, Professor of International Women's Health at Liverpool University.

Prof Weeks added: 'The evidence from the trial is absolutely clear. Lives can be saved by doing nothing. And it doesn't cost the NHS a penny.'
